author: Times Of India
title: GREEN Meghalaya Plus: Meghalaya Chief Minister Launches GREEN Meghalaya Plus Scheme to Boost Forest Conservation | Shillong News - Times of India
text: Shillong: Chief minister Conrad K Sangma on Wednesday launched the GREEN Meghalaya plus scheme at Tura in West Garo Hills district as part of the state govt’s initiative — Payment for Eco System Services (PES). The scheme will provide an incentive of up to Rs 20,000 per hectare per year to communities and individuals for the conservation of forest cover.Green Meghalaya Plus aims to include an additional 50,000 hectares (500 sq km) of forest cover under conservation. In the past, over 3000 individuals or communities benefited from the scheme and conserved more than 54,000 hectares of natural forest.“In the last seven years, govt has laid the foundation and initiated programmes that have benefited our people and accelerated growth and development. There is a huge turnaround in the size of our economy today. As a govt, we are taking advantage of different funds from the state, centre and other external agencies for the growth of our state,” the CM said.We also published the following articles recently27,000 hectares pasture land freed from encroachmentIn 12 districts, Uttar Pradesh's revenue department freed over 27,000 hectares of pasture land from illegal encroachment. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed a village-wise inventory of pastures and plans a large-scale campaign to reclaim remaining land. The reclaimed land will be allocated to animal husbandry, and additional measures for stray cattle welfare are underway.113773756DDA enhances housing schemes with a fresh finish and green spacesDelhi Development Authority (DDA) is enhancing green spaces and finalizing unsold flats in three recent housing schemes. Notably, 1,650 out of 9,000 flats in the Sasta Ghar and Madhyam Vargiya Housing schemes are sold on a first-come, first-served basis. The authority emphasizes cleanliness and collaboration with local bodies, while also improving infrastructure in Narela.113792077Make water conservation part of school syllabus, says CentreThe Union government has urged Goa to integrate water conservation into its school curriculum and engage students in community awareness activities. The NEP 2020 emphasizes environmental sustainability, and eco-clubs will be established across schools under the Mission LIFE programme. Funding of Rs 33 lakh and Rs 3.8 lakh has been provided for primary and elementary school initiatives.113884414

author: BBC News Mundo
title: Asesino del periodista Héctor "El Gato" Félix muere en Tijuana
text:
El Universal Asesino del periodista Héctor "El Gato" Félix muere en Tijuana Leer todo el artículo El Universal 28 de diciembre de 2023, 4:33 p. m. · 1 min de lectura
TIJUANA, BC., diciembre 28 (EL UNIVERSAL).- José Antonio Vera Palestina, asesino del periodista de semanario "Zeta", Héctor Félix Miranda, falleció este jueves durante las primeras horas dentro de un hospital particular, en Tijuana, confirmó Grupo Caliente.
"Quienes formamos la familia Caliente nos solidarizamos con la pena que embarga a familiares y amigos del señor José Antonio Vera Palestina. Compartimos sus sentimientos. Descanse en paz. Ing. Jorge Hank Rhon. Tijuana, Baja California, 28 de diciembre de 2023", dice la publicación compartida con la prensa.
Vera Palestina purgó una condena de 25 años en prisión tras una sentencia condenatoria del Juzgado Segundo de lo Penal de Mexicali, al encontrarlo culpable de su participación en el homicidio del periodista Félix Miranda, el 20 de abril de 1988.
En 2015 fue puesto en libertad y de inmediato incorporado nuevamente al equipo cercano del empresarios del casinos y ex alcalde Jorge Hank Rhon, quien además de ser su compadre h padrino de sus hijos, lo nombró como jefe de su seguridad.
En 2022, fue relacionado con la desaparición de un joven, escolta de la misma empresa encargada de la seguridad de Hank Rhon, cuando una familiar de la víctima reveló que se perdió contacto con el joven después de que Vera Palestina le llamó por teléfono para reunirse Gemma era urgente.

author: deccanchronicle.com
title: Russia Restricts Telegram, WhatsApp Calls
text: Russia Restricts Telegram, WhatsApp Calls Technology Reuters 14 Aug 2025 1:15 PM IST The digital development ministry said Telegram and WhatsApp had ignored repeated requests to take measures to stop their platforms being used for activities such as fraud and terrorism x This photograph shows the mobile messaging and call service Telegram logo and US instant messaging software Whatsapp logo on a smartphone screen in Moscow. (Photo by AFP) Moscow: Russia has started restricting some Telegram and WhatsApp calls, accusing the foreign-owned platforms of failing to share information with law enforcement in fraud and terrorism cases, the digital development ministry said on Wednesday. Russia has clashed with foreign tech platforms for several years over content and data storage in a simmering dispute that intensified after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, with critics saying that Russia is trying to expand its control over the country's internet space. President Vladimir Putin has authorised the development of a state-backed messaging app integrated with government services, as Moscow seeks to establish what it calls digital sovereignty by promoting home-grown services and reducing its dependence on platforms such as WhatsApp and Telegram. "In order to counteract criminals... measures are being taken to partially restrict calls on these foreign messengers," the Interfax news agency quoted communications regulator Roskomnadzor as saying. "No other restrictions have been imposed on their functionality." WhatsApp owner Meta and Telegram did not immediately respond to requests for comment. Telegram, responding to Russia's RBC daily, said it was resisting calls for violence and fraud on its platform and that moderators were using AI tools to monitor public parts of the platform to remove millions of malicious messages every day. Reuters reporters verified the restrictions, noting that voice calls on Telegram had barely functioned since August 11 and that WhatsApp calls had been rendered impossible due to intermittent sound and a metallic buzzing. The digital development ministry said Telegram and WhatsApp had ignored repeated requests to take measures to stop their platforms being used for activities such as fraud and terrorism. The blocking measures, which extend only to calls, would be lifted should the platforms comply with Russian law, the ministry said. This includes opening legal entities in Russia, complying unconditionally with all Russian laws and cooperating with Roskomnadzor and law enforcement, said Anton Gorelkin, deputy head of the lower house of parliament's information technology committee. Meta was branded an extremist organisation by Moscow in 2022, but WhatsApp, widely used in Russia, was allowed to remain. The messenger has received some penalties for failing to remove information banned by Russia. Gorelkin last month said that WhatsApp should prepare to leave the market. Another lawmaker described WhatsApp's presence in the Russian market as a breach of national security. Critics have voiced concerns that Russia's new state-backed messaging app may track its users' activities and have suggested Russia might slow WhatsApp's speeds in order to get users to migrate to the new platform. Human Rights Watch said in a report last month that Russia's government was increasing its technological capacities and control over the country's internet infrastructure, allowing for more widespread blocking and throttling of unwanted websites and censorship circumvention tools. ( Source : Reuters )

author: @andaluciainf
title: Turquía detiene a 32 sospechosos de preparar atentados yihadistas en iglesias y sinagogas | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Cádiz
text: Tres personas sospechosas de preparar atentados contra iglesias y sinagogas en Turquía han sido detenidas dentro de una operación donde han sido arrestadas también otras 29 que se cree tienen contactos con círculos yihadistas y estaban implicados en esos planes. Una operación simultánea en nueve provincias turcas, coordinada por la policía junto a los servicios secretos (MIT), permitió detener a esas tres personas, supuestamente dirigentes de las redes del grupo yihadista Estado Islámico, o Daesh, en Turquía, informa este viernes la agencia oficialista Anadolu. La emisora pública turca TRT los identifica como Miybel el Shuweihi y Mohamed Hilaf Ibrahim, conocido como Abu Leis, sospechosos de preparar atentados contra sinagogas e iglesias en Turquía. El tercero sería Iheb Alani, que se cree estaba coordinando un ataque contra la embajada iraquí en Turquía, agrega la citada emisora. Además, las fuerzas de seguridad han detenido a otras 29 personas sospechosas de estar vinculadas a las redes yihadistas en Turquía. Hace una semana, la Policía detuvo a 304 personas bajo sospecha de mantener lazos con las células del Estado Islámico. Desde el atentado contra la discoteca Reina en Estambul en la Nochevieja de 2016, en la que un yihadista mató con un arma automática a 39 personas, las autoridades turca extreman la vigilancia en estas fechas. Aunque la Nochevieja se celebra popularmente en Turquía y no falta decoración navideña, algunos predicadores radicales se han pronunciado contra estas festividades por "cristianas" o "paganas". Desde el atentado contra el Reina, Turquía, que en 2016-2017 llevó a cabo una operación militar contra el Estado Islámico en el norte de Siria, no ha vuelto a sufrir atentados atribuidos al yihadismo. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)
